page.title: 15EARL STERNDALE W.I.
page.content: {The Womens Institute}meets monthly in Earl Sterndale school with a membership of twenty two from the village and its surround,and includes five from Buxton.Formed nationally in 1915 to educate country women,our Institute,formed in 1962,continues this pattern,with informative talks and practical craft and cookery courses.A committee of eight plans the programme,which includes fund raising for charity and our Institute by means of whist drives and sales events. Socially, we meet for walks,outings to gardens and historic places,and meals.Members range in age from over seventy to early twentys, thirteen being born locally.All have married, three to farmers.Six are full time employment; six are widowed;five have,between them ten children under twelve.Seven members own cars.
